data.title: ‘Road House’ (1989) is Ridiculous

data.text:
Road House takes us into the world of professional bouncers and introduces us to Dalton (Patrick Swayze), one of the best in the business. When he takes an assignment in a small Missouri town, he gets more than he bargained for.

There’s so much to love about this movie; I can see why it’s beloved by so many.

I feel like any discussion of this movie should start with the fight choreography — and there is a lot of fighting. There are so many fighting styles in this film, and each fight is different, just to keep things fun and exciting.

Who doesn’t love watching a bunch of dudes literally kick the crap out of each other? That’s a good 70% of what this movie is.

Road House does have some other things going for it, too, which land with varying effectiveness.

First off, you have Patrick Swayze playing this really cool, calm, and collected man in a profession where you might expect the opposite. When he’s training the other bouncers at the bar, he has three rules that he expects them to follow. The third of which is “be nice.”
